attributes.action: Don't Hold a General Election on account of result of EU Referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has now entered a period of unparalleled uncertainty and this uncertainty is the biggest threat to continuing UK financial stability. 
Financial markets are already unsettled as it is, and a General Election would prolong the uncertainty and economic fallout of Brexit, at everyone's expense.
attributes.additional_details: Uncertainty over the outcome of the EU Referendum already had a significant impact on the UK economy prior to this vote, with foreign direct investment being put on hold as well as stock markets and sterling becoming increasingly volatile. Now a vote to leave has prolonged this period of uncertainty and is likely to have a significant short term economic impact. It is vital that a General Election is not called to ensure that the financial fallout of Brexit is not prolonged for UK households.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: Oppose Wigan Council Application No. A/16/82503/CU
attributes.background: Wigan Council is planning on converting Evolution Nightclub / 36-44 King Street Wigan into restaurants, cafes and residential units. This will seriously damage the nightlife in Wigan and cause many job losses. King street is made up of bars and clubs and employs hundreds of people.
attributes.additional_details: If this plan goes ahead, it will mean that the bars and clubs on King street may receive noise complaints and may have to reduce their noise levels and operating hours. Wigan cannot afford any more unemployment in the town and many of the staff are now worried that they could lose their jobs over this. King street is dependant on its nightlife and see's 1000's of customers every week. Having a residential area in the middle of the street is only the start of what negative's it will bring

attributes.action: Force childcare providers to cap escalating and over priced childcare costs
attributes.background: Since my son has been in private nursery, we have paid £14000. My son has been in nursery for 13 months! Over the course of two years, we would have paid £25000 which is enough for a deposit on a house. This is obscene and believe that childcare should be capped to no more than £45 per day.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do parents have to pay for bank holidays but also for family holidays making it near impossible to go on holiday for some families. Many parents earn nothing after paying childcare fees but yet we are urged to work. With some childcare providers charging in excess of £90 per day, how are we supposed to pay these costs?

attributes.action: When a minor offence becomes 'spent', remove it from a person's enhanced DBS.
attributes.background: When I was young, I got into trouble with the police which resulted in a criminal record; these were minor offences. All my convictions are now spent but they still show up on an enhanced DBS check which makes it difficult to find alternative employment.We shouldn't be judged by juvenile mistakes.
attributes.additional_details: After a search online, it became apparent that this issue is common. There are many skilled and qualified people who are more than capable of doing there job but employers won't take the risk because of a document which states information from 5, 10, 15 even 30 years ago.

attributes.action: Make cycling on a footway an arrestable offence and raise the fine to £1,000.
attributes.background: It is a criminal offence in England and Wales to cycle on footways such as pavements, walkways and foot bridges. The current penalty for this is a measly £50 fine despite the danger to pedestrians.  Cycling on footways should be arrestable, the fine increased to £1,000 and cycles seized until paid.
attributes.additional_details:
With the popularity of cycling in the UK on the up, the numbers of people regularly committing offences such as cycling on the pavement is also increasing. Research has shown that cyclists now represent almost as much danger to pedestrians as motorists do, that the injuries inflicted can be as damaging and nearly 100 people in the UK are killed by cyclists each year.

Making this offence arrestable and increasing the fine will act as a better deterrent and improve pedestrian safety.

attributes.action: Reinstate the personal tax allowance for people earning over £100,000 pa.
attributes.background: Tax system flaws leave professionals paying 60 per cent tax, yet those on higher income pay just 45%.
attributes.additional_details:
Above the £10,600 tax-free personal allowance there are three bands of income tax people pay on earnings: 20pc (basic rate - from £10,600), 40pc (higher rate - from £42,385) and 45pc (additional rate - from £150,000). 

But people earning over £100,000 gradually have their personal allowance removed at a rate of £1 for every £2 earned above the threshold, up to £121,200. This means a "fourth" band of "marginal tax" is created in which they pay 60pc on income in between these levels, plus 2pc for national insurance, a total rate of 62pc. 
Workers pocket just 38pc of the income they earn between these levels. It means, ludicrously, that they pay a higher marginal tax rate than people who earn far more.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law, on Section 75 Credit Act to apply on debit cards.
attributes.background: A petition calling on Parliament to change the law, so that Section 75 of the Consumer Credit Act applies to debit cards in the same way that it applies to credit cards.
attributes.additional_details:
MAKE BANKS TO REFUND CHARGEBACK TO SMALL BUSINESS VICTIMS OF FRAUD.

Bank don’t pay chargeback on a debit card, fraud is no legal obligation as in Section 75 with Credit Cards. As a small business sole trader I became a victim of fraud losing £4271.39 to a supplier in Holland.

I wrote to Action fraud, the British police, the Dutch police, the Dutch embassy in London still no one can help, I went to the citizen advice, and even my MP tried to help but dead end. I believe banks should consider and realise how small businesses are affected by fraudsters and chargeback accordingly to exceptional circumstances. It is unbelievable that in such according to my experience no one is helping.

attributes.action: Replace extortionate fees (24%) charged to parents by CMS with standard fee.
attributes.background: Paying parent pays 20% - receiving parent pays 4% to CMS for setting up direct debit.  Fees are disproportionate to the effort required by CMS to effect payment.  Fees are significantly more than fees charged to make simple bank transfer or BACS payment, regardless of the amount involved.
attributes.additional_details: The 24% charge is a standard charge, whether payment is £1 or £1000.  This fee amounts to a lot for some paying parents and represents money that could be better spent on the children.  The CMS should at least explain the reasons for this extortionate fee level, and be transparent about what they actually do to deserve such a fee.  Monies already paid by parents should receive a refund along the lines of the PPI scandal.  (Will give CMS something to do!)

attributes.action: Free dental & optical treatment inc free glasses for diabetics.
attributes.background: Myself and other people who suffer from diabetes know the complications we suffer with our dental and eyesight problems, Causing very uncomfortable pain and strain. We are constantly paying huge bills to our dentists and opticians on a regular Basis for treatment we need, that we cannot prevent.
attributes.additional_details:
Diabetes is the leading cause of blindness in adults aged 20 to 74. High blood sugar which cannot always be prevented causes the lens of the eye to swell, which changes our ability to see.
Gum disease is much more common In a person who suffers from diabetes, this is because the red blood cells cannot fight infection as well as a non sufferer, causing pain and in time, brittle teeth. This in turn forces us to visit the dentist a lot more often than the average person.

attributes.action: All lorries that come into Dover should be checked
attributes.background: Some lorries are allowed into the country without being checked for illegal immigrants or narcotics and this should not be the case. All lorries should be checked in order to reduce the amount of illegal immigrants that are allowed into the country.

attributes.action: Change the law to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition is change the law, to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence, with specific minimum punishments for those convicted.
With social media becoming the main portal for people to share their lives with others, cyber bullying is on the increase.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullies must face harsher punishments. With self harming and suicide on the rise, social media truly does play a part with it being noted that all teenagers who socialise online will come across cyber bullying at least once. However, it is not just teenagers who are subjected to this online torture, with the internet becoming the new venue to host the modern day witch hunt. It is time that cyber bullies were held accountable and suitably sentenced for their actions.

attributes.action: Make Mondays part of the weekend every week.
attributes.background: We all work too hard and we need more time off.
attributes.additional_details: It's as simple as that.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for pension funds to be plundered.
attributes.background: Once again an "entrepreneur" has plundered the pension fund of many working people - this time British Home Stores.  The shortfall will have to be met by the British Taxpayer while the "entrepreneur" walks away.
attributes.additional_details: When Robert Maxwell, another "entrepreneur", plundered pension funds  years ago there was a public outcry but nothing has been done to prevent this happening again.  Why not?  Pension funds should be ring-fenced so that they cannot be plundered.  The money which will have to be found to meet this pension gap would be spent better on doctors, nurses, the NHS in general, better treatment of the older generation and many other causes. Meanwhile the person responsible for this walks away.

attributes.action: Increase refuge spaces for male survivors of domestic violence
attributes.background: Currently there are only 11 government funded refuge places for male survivors of domestic violence yet 40% of domestic violence is against males

attributes.action: Spend revenue from closing tax loopholes on carbon capture & storage technology
attributes.background: I think a percentage of the money the government gains from closing tax loopholes should be invested. The single biggest threat facing the world is global warming. A lot of money is being invested in renewables but not enough into capturing carbon from existing fossil fuel consumption.
attributes.additional_details: There is a technology called Carbon Capture & Storage (CCS). This captures up to 90% of the carbon from fossil fuel power stations and other industry when it is fitted. If more money was invested in this technology, it would reduce the manufacturing cost more companies could start fitting it to new power stations and possibly existing power stations and industry thus reducing emissions.

attributes.action: Allow katy James to stay in the Uk with her husband and 2 year old daughter!
attributes.background:
Katy has been married to her husband Dominic for 9 years and they have a 2 year old daughter, Katy has been denied a visa because her husband doesn't "earn enough"

This is unfair and no parent should be seperated from their child

attributes.action: Review childcare provisions for older children with Special educational needs.
attributes.background: This is a call for the government to review child care provision for older children, aged 11-18 with special educational needs. Due to the lack of childcare provision for secondary school aged children many parents are forced to reduce their hours or leave work all together.
attributes.additional_details: A distinction needs to be made between personal care provision and child care. Personal one to one care is extremely expensive (11-20 per hours) when compared to the cost of child care (3.50 - 6 per hour). Personal care is also on a one to one basis where older children with special education would benefit more from the extra social interaction, after schools groups can provide. This lack of provision leads to an increased likelihood in benefit dependency and social exclusion.

attributes.action: DVLA need a telephone customer department that corrects the mistakes they  make
attributes.background:
DVLA fined us for their mistake with our DIrect Debit.
It has been shocking to find they have no telephone service for their mistakes to be sorted out.  Only telephone lines to pay the "fine" even when you don't owe them it. Very stressful time trying to sort it out.

attributes.action: all petitions with over 200000 signatures put to uk general election style vote
attributes.background:
petitions are often signed and not even discussed in parmlimant this gives the uk public a lack of confidence in the whole petition consept 
if every petition that reached 200000 signatures had to be voted on in an election style vote uk opinons would be voiced from the people for the people
attributes.additional_details:
this concept could be easily implimented by adding all succsesfull petitons to local and or general election questionares forms and voted on the same day reducing cost and increasing likelyhood to vote

the number 200000 is only a ballpar amount of votes if sucsesfull the amount of signature could be agreed upon for less or more but a garuntee of public intrest in the petiton idea would sertainly be sparked because the whole petition basis would have a more definative and resolved end result

attributes.action: Whilst respecting Freedom of Speech Laws, Holocaust denial should be a crime.
attributes.background: The Holocaust saw 6 million Jews and countless millions of others executed in concentration camps. The Holocaust is a historical fact taught in our schools. Whilst we have freedom of speech, we should specifically criminalise it's denial as it can be used to further anti-semitism within our society.
attributes.additional_details: A number of countries have laws against denying the Holocaust and many historians and politicians have stated that it has enabled anti-semitism to be tackled more proactively. In some European countries there are increasingly greater numbers of anti-semitic attacks and hate crimes, as well as the election of anti-semitic parties. In Britain anti-semitism is sadly rising as official reported crime figures show. Anti-Semitic hate crimes are already criminalised, but denial of the Holocaust is not.

attributes.action: Teach Creationism (Bible) as a Fact in all State and Academy Schools
attributes.background: This petition is saying that the fact of Biblical creationism should be compulsory in all state and academy schools, and for it to be taught as the fact.
attributes.additional_details: Genesis, which was written around 1,500 BC in the Bible is the truth of God's word, as written by Moses from God's instructions. If we really want to keep the United Kingdom a Christian nation, rather than an atheist nation, we must teach compulsive Creationism in all schools across the UK.

attributes.action: Lower the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the equivalent of Scotland
attributes.background:
In England and Wales, the alcohol limit for drivers is 80 milligrammes of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. On December 5th 2014 the alcohol limit for drivers in Scotland reduced from 80 to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood.
This is far safer.
attributes.additional_details:
The Scottish Government say they have changed their drink drive limit to bring Scotland in line with most other European countries, to save lives and make Scotland’s roads safer.
Many of the functions that we depend on to drive safely are affected when we drink alcohol: 
the brain takes longer to receive messages from the eye
processing information becomes more difficult
slower reaction times.
blurred and double vision, affects your ability to see things clearly while you are driving.

attributes.action: Raise the lifetime ISA upper age limit from 40 to 45.
attributes.background: The 40 year upper limit for the new life time ISA is too low. People upto the age of 45 should have this opportunity as well.

attributes.action: Introduce other religious leaders into the house of lords to make it democratic
attributes.background: The only religious leaders in the House of Lords are bishops and arch bishops but as Britain is now a multi faith country other religious leaders from Muslim, Hindu and Sikh (etc) faiths should be entered to the house in order to offer greater representation and democracy and scrutiny in Britain.

attributes.action: Introduce a temporary visa scheme for refugees
attributes.background: The introduction of a temporary visa scheme would allow safe temporary refuge to people escaping war and persecution. This would allow each case to be reviewed and when circumstances allowed, the refugees could be returned to their home country.  The visa would be granted for up to 3 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of our allies in the world use visa systems to control the influx of refugees and immigrants into their countries. It is made perfectly clear that the visa is temporary and this cannot be appealed. The UAE is an example. Visas there are only issued as temporary time limited visit or residency visas. 

In the case of refugees, once the situation is deemed to have improved in their country they return home to re-settle and rebuild their own country. No appeal to stay should be allowed.

attributes.action: Completely ban Sunday trading for high-street retailers.
attributes.background: Sunday is a special day, families and communities gather on the seventh day to 'rest.' Unfortunately, the majority of employment contracts make workers who would participate in religious activities or spend time with their families have to go to work.
attributes.additional_details: It's sad to see that as Sunday trading laws have become more lenient, divorce rates have increased. Family time is now more unusual and many people refused to do such things as mow the lawn on Sundays until supermarkets broke the law and got their way.

attributes.action: Reimburse UK companies of tariffs when trading with the EU, if the UK leaves EU.
attributes.background: If UK left the EU there would be a renegotiation period. In this period companies will need to pay tariffs. This petition is to protect all UK businesses that rely on EU free-trade agreement. This idea would mean UK Government would reimburse UK companies on tariffs, using tariffs received from EU.
attributes.additional_details: With the UK trading at a deficit with the EU, more tariffs will be paid by EU companies to our Government than UK companies to EU Governments. A new Tariff Reimbursement Transition Period could be introduced to help our companies trading with the EU. This will mean our Government reimburses UK companies on tariffs paid to EU Governments using money received in tariffs from EU companies. This would effectively make it free trade for UK companies whilst the UK negotiate free trade deals with EU.

attributes.action: Make the selling of electronic devices with pre-installed malware/adware illegal
attributes.background: A lot of low-end tablets and phones come with pre-installed malware and ad-ware that is a big security risk for the user, normally it is also not possible to remove these

attributes.action: Introduce Dental Receptionists to be registered professionals with the GDC
attributes.background: I believe it's important for all dental receptionists to feel they are as important as registered professionals. Dental receptionists are the first and last point of call for patients.
attributes.additional_details: I also believe that it would give dental receptionists a higher profile and feel important to the dental team. I have spoken to a dental receptionist and she has stated that she believes it's important for these changes to be made as it would benefit the dental services and feels it would have a positive impact on dental receptionists to feel as important as the rest of the dental team.  I believe that they should be registered with the general dental council to have a responsibility for keeping up to date with standards and prove that they are continuing personal development but also be accountable for their actions.

attributes.action: Ban companies from selling sweatshop made products in the UK
attributes.background: There are children as young as 6 and 7 working 16 hour weeks for as little as 18p an hour. We want the UK government to ban companies who employ people under 16 in factories selling those clothes in this country. We want fair working hours for all and improved working conditions.
attributes.additional_details: If worker were to have their wages doubled that would be a significant amount of money for them but to us it would mean an increase of just 1.8% which is nothing. We want the UK to ban companies who use sweatshops from selling those products in this country. We want the UK government to apply more pressure on the UN to do more to bring a complete end to sweatshops.

attributes.action: Recognise Israel's atrocities against Palestinians and take action to stop it.
attributes.background:
Israel continues to breach the human rights of Palestinians in its illegal occupation of the West Bank  and Gaza. 

I, as a UK citizen petition the UK Government to take action to isolate Israel in the international community until it changes its course and ends its apartheid against Palestinians.
attributes.additional_details:
The action should include:

1. Draft a fresh UN resolution. 
2. Impose full sanctions against Israel
3. Stop selling arms.
4. Proscribe the IDF as a weapon of terror. 
5. Require a plebiscite open to all residents (including refugees) to vote for either a 1 State solution where everyone has 100% equal rights or for a 2 State solution where both States are recognised and have all the comensurate rights and responsibilities of nationhood. 
6. Establish a legal process to compensate Palestinians.

attributes.action: Give people in Overseas Territories & Crown Dependencies an EU referendum vote.
attributes.background: There are an estimated 350,000 British Citizens living in British Overseas Territories around the world and 250,000 British Citizens living in the Crown Dependencies of Jersey, Guernsey and the Isle of Mann. These people are also European Union Citizens and should be given a vote on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: The Overseas Territories and Crown Dependencies receive large sums of money from the European Union for development purposes. The Overseas Territory of Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha for example, with a population of around 8,000 people, relies heavily on the European Development Fund with the 11th EDF granting the territory 21.5 million Euros. The loss of such funding and other benefits of UK European Union membership would be devastating to such small island communities.

attributes.action: Refer Amazon to the competition authorities.
attributes.background: In The Telegraph interview Rohan Silva, a former adviser to David Cameron and George Osborne, said the lack of competition in the book market is “really horrifying”, allowing Amazon to dominate.I’m absolutely aghast about what the government and competition authorities have allowed Amazon to do.
attributes.additional_details:
What the Society of Authors and their memebers think of Amazon can be found here: http://www.societyofauthors.org/what-do-we-think-amazon

The background to this petition can be found at this link: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/shopping-and-consumer-news/12167545/Government-must-help-end-heartbreaking-Amazon-dominance-former-Number-10-adviser-says.html?WT.mc_id=e_DM89475&WT.tsrc=email&etype=Edi_Pol_New_EU&utm_source=email&utm_medium=Edi_Pol_New_EU_2016_02_22&utm_campaign=DM89475

attributes.action: Illegal to charge people more who are already in debt
attributes.background: When people are in debt it's normally because they don't have a lot of money. However debt collection agents and courts think it's fine to kick people when their down and put extra charges on .people need help not more debt Ie bailiff charge. Court charge
attributes.additional_details: People actually commit suicide because of debt and bully boy tactics. Court's don't help by putting more debt on with extra charges .more help needs to be given to people in debt. Not extra cost that increases that debt extra charges need to be illegal and just the original debt paid

attributes.action: Absent parent to have automatic access to education health and welfare records
attributes.background: In breakdown of relationships the absent parent is often powerless in obtaining information in relation to their child's education health and welfare. Unless safeguarding issues absent parent has automatic right to have direct access to health Records/results and school progress reports/exam results
attributes.additional_details: Asking hospital staff to be included in dialogue about their child as absent parent is frustrating and seems currently relies on asking the parent with care. There should be a set procedure in relation to this which should be documented and highlighted to ensure there are clear expectations and outcomes. Parents don't stop being parents Just because the relationship between their partner breaks down. There needs to be equity wuth both parents not automatic to parent with care.

attributes.action: re nationalise the energy companies
attributes.background: British Gas today announced an increase in profits to £574 million pounds a 31% increase, not for the first time that profits have increased. The regulator seems to be serving the energy companies and not the consumers who have to pay. I'm sure the dividend payed to shareholders will rise.
attributes.additional_details: Its about time consumers get a fair deal for the cost of energy. When we had Nationally owned energy companies it was the Government who decided on the cost. Wholesale gas prices have dropped by 40% and slowly the energy companies are reducing the cost but not fast and always after winter and never enough. Re Nationalise the energy companies or at the very least put in place a regulator who actually represents the consumers.

attributes.action: Delay EU membership referendum until EU Parliament approval for agreements
attributes.background: The British Parliament should prevent any referendum on British membership of the EU being held before European Parliamentary approval has been obtained for agreements made with EU leaders.
attributes.additional_details:
Agreements with EU leaders concerning UK renegotiations of membership will be subject to European Parliament’s approval and may result in modification to those agreements. Any referendum should therefore not be held until such approval has been obtained, otherwise the referendum would be based upon incomplete and perhaps erroneous information.
Alternatively if the referendum occurs before such approval and any significant changes are made during that process, a second referendum should be held

attributes.action: Call for EU sanctions against Denmark until whaling is stopped in Faroe Islands
attributes.background: The Faeroe islands kill hundreds of whales and dolphins every year. The rest of the world, apart from Japan, have put whaling behind them. The Danish government are allowing whaling to continue and even supporting it through military action. The pointless murder of whale and dolphins must be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Check out the UK Government IWC document from 2008
Check out Sea Shepherd conservation society

attributes.action: Let the public veto unpopular proposed government legislation by online vote.
attributes.background: The government shouldn't be able to enact widely derided and unpopular legislation that the people don't want. We need a system that allows the public to have a voice away from the voting booth at general elections.
attributes.additional_details: If more people sign up to veto a piece of proposed legislation than voted the government in at the last general election, then that legislation should automatically be vetoed. That would be true democracy, give an alternative to strike action, and would protect against the most destructive of government actions against the people they're supposed to represent.

attributes.action: Make take away shops use bio-degradable containers for serving food near beaches
attributes.background: I used to work on Brighton beach as a lifeguard. At high tide there would be a line of rubbish, much of it plastic, marking the high tide. As the tide began making its way back out there would be a thick line of rubbish left along the beach... what about the rubbish that was carried out to sea?!!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/environment/gallery/2009/apr/08/waste-marine-life what happens to the rubbish that is lost to the sea?

The Great Pacific Garbage Patch - The worlds largest plastic rubbish dump. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1qT-rOXB6NI
Banning plastic from the beaches will not cure the problem but we have to start somewhere.

attributes.action: Exempt litigants-in-person from cost orders
attributes.background: With no legal aid, low income persons are forced to be litigants in person. Judges do not decide in favour of litigants-in-person almost as a rule. They use their discretion to favour the rich and represented party. Astronomical costs are then imposed on the poor litigant-in-person. This is unjust.

attributes.action: The NHS must be funded by a separate tax, with all funds going exclusively to it
attributes.background: The NHS should not be a political football. We all value the NHS, we all want it funded. We don't want politicians playing with it for their own ends. A separate tax allows for the NHS to be funded by a specific tax which can be raised (or reduced) as necessary to fund the needs of the service.
attributes.additional_details:
We used to have a direct link between National Insurance and the NHS. Funds raised were used for the NHS. That link has been broken. We should allow people to pay more tax (an income tax which is progressive) for the NHS without necessarily raising the general rate of taxation.
Having the NHS fully funded by the taxpayer will reduce the possibility of politicians playing games with our health for their own political ends.

attributes.action: No appeals for deportation of illegal immigrants and failed asylum seekers
attributes.background: Too many illegals abscond whilst their appeal is being considered UK Border Force should have the power to remove illegal immigrants

attributes.action: Ban the sale of over the counter codeine based pain killer medication
attributes.background: In the last few years there has been an increase in the number of people becoming addicted to OTC pain medication. This medication is a legal form of morphine and causes as many problems for people addicted to it as illegal class a and b drugs.
attributes.additional_details: People addicted to the medication do not cause problems for society, they do not steal property, mug people or cause the police service any problems at all. This is because the medication is very cheap, easy to get hold of and legal to have. People caught in the grip of addiction live on a day to day basis always needing to know they are able to get their fix, their lives are lived under dark clouds with often no help being offered to get away from it as it is not seen as a problem.

attributes.action: Ban Free Pornoraphy Online. Regulate subscription Porn to safeguard under 18's
attributes.background: Paid for Professional Pornoraphy should be Government regulated to ensure no one is underage, and no one underage is subscribing to it. Free Pornoraphy cannot ensure these measures. It has infact lead to child abuse. Being exposed to such things at a young age should also be considered child abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Between data, Wifi spots and other people's devices, you cannot safeguard children and young people from exposure, by parental controls and filters alone. It is a disgrace that it is Online in the first place, and many involved, females and males, are likely being plied with drugs and alcohol.

attributes.action: Recognise colour blindness as a disability.
attributes.background: Our son is colour blind and is unable to help his children with colouring, conversations regarding colour etc, purchasing items etc. Please mark crayons, felt tips etc with the name of the colour enabling colour blind people to participate in normal parental activities.

attributes.action: Stop NHS appointment record cards advertising Claims Companies on them.
attributes.background: Seeing that a full page was allowed to be advertising and encouraging the general public to seek legal advise after visiting a hospital is encouraging people to become more litigious. The NHS is seen as advising people to seek out ways to make money by claiming and they are in a position of trust.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell more than 2 packets of paracetamol in one transaction
attributes.background: Retailers can sell 100 paracetamol in a single transaction, as long as the packets only contain 16 tablets. Some retailers limit it to 2 packets however this is individual store policy. This should become the law, as it will reduce accidental and intentional overdoses, saving lives and NHS money.
attributes.additional_details:
There are guidelines released by MHRA (The Medicines and Healthcare  products Regulatory Agency) recommending that sales are limited to two packets and does not occur within a promotional deal.

Limiting sales will not stop overdoses from occurring, but it will make people more conscious of the dangers of paracetamol for accidental overdoses, and those intending to commit suicide will have to go to multiple stores, giving the person longer to think, rather than act on impulse.

attributes.action: Ban the use of glycophosate on UK food crops
attributes.background: Glycophosate is classified by The World Health Organisation as a "probable carcinogen" and yet it is used by farmers all over the UK on cereal crops as a weed killer to kill the crops before harvesting to make the process easier. Traces remain in our bread.
attributes.additional_details:
The Soil Association has more information here: http://www.soilassociation.org/ourcampaigns/glyphosate/glyphosatedanger

http://www.soilassociation.org/LinkClick.aspx?fileticket=CLfCaRC5p6E%3d&tabid=313

http://www.soilassociation.org/notinourbread
